message_1: What is the remainder when 7^325 is divided by 6?
message_2:
To find the remainder when 7^325 is divided by 6, we can use the property of modular arithmetic. We know that 7 is congruent to 1 modulo 6, which means that 7 and 1 have the same remainder when divided by 6.

7 ≡ 1 (mod 6)

Now, we can raise both sides of the congruence to the power of 325:

(7^325) ≡ (1^325) (mod 6)

Since 1 raised to any power is still 1, we have:

7^325 ≡ 1 (mod 6)

This means that the remainder when 7^325 is divided by 6 is 1.
